description: {"blocks":[{"key":"2b95q","text":"This specific protocol is for the TMA TNP cases.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"acjqo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a7l2h","text":"Understanding immune complexity within the tumor microenvironment provides valuable insight to tumor-immune composition, spatial interactions, and the immune system's reaction to therapy allowing us to better understand response and resistance at the interface of the tumor and host. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7g0uf","text":"Multiplex IHC allows for the simultaneous detection of multiple Ab targets in the same tissue section using published methods previously described1,2.This protocol contains detailed instructions on how to prepare files and run the image processing pipeline for mIHC SVS images in a GUI or command line, making it accessible to biologist and labs without computational specialty. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":146,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1caj5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ei4bo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"25i2j","text":"REFERENCES","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":0,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f7di6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2j88k","text":"Tsujikawa, Takahiro, et al. \"Quantitative multiplex immunohistochemistry reveals myeloid-inflamed tumor-immune complexity associated with poor prognosis.\"Cell reports19.1 (2017): 203-217","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":154,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1spuo","text":"Banik, Grace, et al. \"High-dimensional multiplexed immunohistochemical characterization of immune contexture in human cancers.\"Methods in enzymology635 (2020): 1-20.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":127,"length":21}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4k01e","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"f00oh","text":"PIPELINE OVERVIEW","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"68ca2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2kg0g","text":"Once file names and folder structure is properly formatted for mIHC image processing, batch analysis can be performed. For every slide, multiple regions can be selected, avoiding regions of tissue deformation, necrosis, or other artifact or trouble tissue regions. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"pk1f","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5nvhb","text":"The image processing workflow utilizes steps commonly found in biological image analysis that have been optimized for brightfield RGB multplexIHC images with AEC chromogen and hematoxylin. Although image processing can be completely automated, it is highly recommended that each step is checked to ensure data is as expected and is of high enough quality to continue processing. The modular steps allow for QC and adjustments at each major step. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1tdms","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"a3qm9","text":"Brief Description of Image Processing Workflow ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":47}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"apckp","text":"Each region is registered to the final stained hematoxylin image from the same area, aligning each image such that major shifts due to repetitive scanning are adjusted for. Color deconvolution separates the AEC conjugated Ab signal from background. Single cell nuclei segmentation identifies cell areas using hematoxylin stain. {"blocks":[{"key":"78t8n","text":"NUCLEI SEGMENTATION","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2dim1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"776df","text":"Segmentation is performed using the StarDist 2D_versatile_fluo algorithm implemented in FIJI python:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8lnd7","text":"stardist/stardist: StarDist - Object Detection with Star-convex Shapes (github.com)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":83}],"data":{}},{"key":"alap7","text":"(Martin Weigert, Uwe Schmidt, Robert Haase, Ko Sugawara, and Gene Myers.\nStar-convex Polyhedra for 3D Object Detection and Segmentation in Microscopy.\nThe IEEE Winter Conference on Applications of Computer Vision (WACV), Snowmass Village, Colorado, March 2020) ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":73,"length":76}],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":73,"length":76}],"data":{}},{"key":"aubqt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7juka","text":"Segmentation can be performed on any single channel nuclear stain, preferably from the end of the staining panel to ensure only cells maintained throughout all staining cycles are evaluated downstream. If using a nuclear stain early in the panel, tissue and cells lost during the staining process can result in false negatives. We have optimized an antibody cocktail of H3+Nuclear Antigen to robustly identify single cell nuclei and this is recommended for segmentation in this pipeline.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8s2tm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dkba1","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"akohr","text":"BatchStardistSegmentation_H3NUCA.py","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":35}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bcuee","text":"The script runs on the Parent directory and creates a labeled image for each ROI inside the Processed folder with a prefix, 'label_', based on the nuclei image named with 'V_H3NUCA_*'. This can be modified to identify any nuclei image name.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eihbn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3ij91","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a0rt3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dbs80","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ja7n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1uk4r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"5361FF47A8B911EDA7F80A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://github.com/stardist/stardist"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"3E5FA82BA8B911EDA7F80A58A9FEAC02","url":"http://openaccess.thecvf.com/content_WACV_2020/papers/Weigert_Star-convex_Polyhedra_for_3D_Object_Detection_and_Segmentation_in_Microscopy_WACV_2020_paper.pdf"}},"2":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"EF91C2843B9511EE94F30A58A9FEAC02","height":182,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"5ac2r\",\"text\":\"Left
